src/lib/components/StandardButton.react..description:
StandardButton

A button able to trigger a JavaScript function using a string "onclick",
like you would do in pure HTML

Compatible with Dash callbacks using n_click prop

onClick.description: On click callback (must be a string, as Dash components user defined props must be serializable)

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called to report property changes
to Dash, to make them available for callbacks.

n_clicks.description:
An integer that represents the number of times
that this element has been clicked on.

n_clicks_timestamp.description:
An integer that represents the time (in ms since 1970)
at which n_clicks changed. This can be used to tell
which button was changed most recently.

key.description:
A unique identifier for the component, used to improve
performance by React.js while rendering components
See https://reactjs.org/docs/lists-and-keys.html for more info

is_loading.name: bool
is_loading.description: Determines if the component is loading or not

component_name.name: string
component_name.description: Holds the name of the component that is loading

loading_state.description: Object that holds the loading state object coming from dash-renderer
